predefined_profiles.name: Haruki
predefined_profiles.public profile: Haruki is the class president of Class 2-1 at Houjo High School, excels academically, is very active in clubs, and is quite handsome. In the second half of his second year, he wants to form a band for the school festival and perform as the guitarist. He is a beginner at guitar and did not have deep musical knowledge before, so he stays in the classroom every day after school to practice hard.
predefined_profiles.goal: Hopes to perform successfully at the school festival
predefined_profiles.private profile: Due to being the class president and his personality, he's a well-meaning person who likes to meddle in others’ affairs.

predefined_profiles.name: Takeya
predefined_profiles.public profile: Takeya is Haruki's classmate and a very good friend of his. He has been actively helping Haruki form a band recently, hoping to help his good friend realize his wish to perform on stage.
predefined_profiles.goal: Wants to peacefully and happily spend his high school days

scenario: After school, Haruki and Takeya stayed in the classroom, and when only the two of them were left, they began to practice guitar. Takeya seemed to have something he wanted to tell Haruki, but he appeared very hesitant, repeatedly lowering his extended hand.

profile.name: Liu Wan
profile.public profile: Lead singer of the band where Haruki is, girlfriend of Wu Ye, very popular in school. Despite being public about her relationship with Wu Ye, many other band members secretly admire her.
profile.goal: Become a campus idol, wants to be liked by everyone

dialog.content: After school, Haruki and Wu Ye stayed behind in the classroom. Once it was just the two of them, they began to practice guitar. Wu Ye seemed to have something he wanted to tell Haruki, but he hesitated, his hand repeatedly reaching out only to drop down again.
If there’s something on your mind, just say it. You look like you’ve got something to tell me; you’ve been looking my way back and forth several times now.
Hehe, you caught me. Well, it looks like our band's lead singer can't make it anymore. I broke up with her recently, so she probably won't be coming to the band anymore.
What, you broke up?! Could you at least let me know before making such decisions? And didn’t you just start dating Liu Wan? It hasn’t even been six months; why so sudden?
There are reasons that are a bit difficult to explain, so we broke up. Now the bigger problem is that all the other band members were taken along by Liu Wan. The band is just the two of us now.

(Still reeling from the breakup news, and now hearing another bad news) The others were...taken away? How does your breakup end up disbanding the whole band? This is too devastating, with only two months until the school festival.

Well, if that's the case, maybe we should drop it. If you want to form a band, I can help you find suitable members. Even if we can't perform at the school festival, we can practice for half a year and perform at next year's graduation party. There's no rush.

content.content: You're right. Even if we can't make it for this year's school festival, I still have a chance next year. At least before I graduate from high school, I can realize my dream of forming a band.
We don't necessarily have to form a band for the school festival. How about we do a comedy sketch or some street dancing instead? What do you think?

(With a hint of self-deprecation and pessimism in the tone) Yeah, although we can't do it for this year's festival, maybe next year. But honestly, I don't dare to get my hopes up too high. Everyone will be getting busier, and we might just drift apart. The band dream might just remain a thought; who knows if it'll come true.
Never mind everything else, why did you break up with Liu Wan? Don’t brush it off; I want to know the reason.

question: #question#How would Haruki, maintaining an optimistic outlook on the future, view this situation?

content.content: I'm going to keep trying. There's still two months left, maybe I can find a new lead singer and other members. There's still a chance to perform, so I'll practice the guitar more today. In times like this, I can't give up practicing.

Why does your breakup have such a massive chain reaction? Not only are we without a lead singer, but all the other teammates also left. Now it's just me; it's too tough. How can we play in a band now?
You change girlfriends too fast. It feels like none of your relationships last long. You should really reflect on yourself.

I can't wait until next year's graduation party. The future is too uncertain; no one can say for sure. It would be best if I could perform this year. Can't you really join me? Ah, forget it, so many people aren't willing; I'll just give up too.

question: #question#How should Haruki express his determination to persevere in completing tasks and striving toward his goals?

dialog.content: Since you've said that, I'm relieved. Are we practicing guitar this afternoon? Or should we head out for a little gathering somewhere? I'll treat you, as a compensation for not being able to form a band this year.
Let's go to that dessert shop you mentioned last time. I've never had the chance to go. This time we can finally try their new mint-flavored ice cream.

Faced with the departure of the band’s lead vocalist, Chunxi found it impossible to rebuild the band in a short time. He decided not to dwell on it anymore. After having ice cream with Wu Ye, they headed to the arcade and gamed all night. The idea of forming a band was shelved, and no one mentioned it again. Chunxi's dream of music faded away with time.
I'm really sorry. I'll find a chance to make it up to you later. I'm heading back today. Ever since the breakup, I've been feeling quite unsettled, but I'll get back to practice as soon as I can.

Alright, you can go back today. I'll think more about the band; there must be a way. (Chunxi begins to practice the guitar seriously. Being a beginner, and with today's added agitation, the guitar sounds aren't quite melodious.)

profile.name: Dongma
profile.public profile: A classmate of Chunxi, seated to his left. Doesn't normally socialize with classmates, except for class leader Chunxi who initiates conversations over various minor things.
profile.private profile: Dongma's mother is a world-renowned pianist. Due to her busy work schedule, she neglected to spend time with Dongma. Consequently, Dongma's childhood was filled with piano practice and an empty home. After entering her second year of high school, Dongma grew weary and transferred from the music class to Chunxi's regular class, frequently coming to school late and generally napping on the desk after class.
profile.goal: Hopes someone will care for and love her

dialog.content: (After school that day, unable to resist, she sneaks into a classroom with a piano and starts playing gently. The room next door is where Chunxi is practicing his guitar.) I wonder who's playing the guitar next door. This sound is an insult to the guitar. What kind of idiot plays like this? That's not how you play a guitar.

(Pleasant piano music comes from next door, harmonizing with his current piece and seemingly guiding him to strike the correct notes.) Wow, with the piano accompaniment, I feel like I can play the guitar better. This is one of the few pieces of good news today.

(They’ve been playing together for over half an hour when the guitar sounds suddenly stop.) Huh? Why did it suddenly stop? Practicing guitar should start with at least an hour, practicing for just half an hour is too lazy.

content.content: (Leaves the room and heads to the piano classroom next door, knocks gently) Hello, sorry to bother you. I heard your piano playing from next door. Our band is currently in need of a keyboardist. Would you consider joining us?
Do you practice piano until late every day? If the school gates are locked, how do you get out? I've always worried about this, so I only practice for a bit after school before leaving.
Is it a music student playing the piano in the classroom? I've just started learning guitar, could I ask you a few questions about music? How have you managed to stay on this path for so long?

Hello, is there someone in this classroom? I just heard a fantastic piano performance. Could we chat for a bit? Are you interested in being in a band? If you are, you'll have to meet some great standards quickly. Show me your skill level so I can see if you're a fit.

question: #question# How should Chunxi express that he can quickly assess the situation and adjust his goals?

content.content: There’s been too much going on today. After practicing the guitar, I'll go have dinner. A new Japanese place opened near my home. I’ll give it a try later, hoping for a surprise. I can't keep my nerves this tense forever.

Sigh, I regret it. I probably shouldn't have formed a band with Wuya. His personality seemed bound to cause problems sooner or later. I should have thought of this earlier. How could I be so clueless about people?
When will I be able to play as well as the student next door? Is intense practice really the right method? How can I be so bad, always running into troubles forming a band? It's really frustrating.
It would be great if we could recruit the student playing piano next door into the band. The current situation is really difficult. There’s no person, no skill. I really don’t know what to do next.

question: #question# How can Chunxi express that he can effectively regulate his stress, anxiety, and other emotions?

dialog.content: (Without opening the door, speaking to Haruki from behind the door) You must have heard wrong; no one is playing the piano here. I'm a music student, and the teacher sent me to clean the music room. I'll be leaving soon, so if there's nothing else, please go back.

I'm sorry for being so abrupt earlier by suddenly coming up to say hello. I hope I didn’t startle you. I'm the guy practicing guitar in the next room—a beginner. I want to perform at the school festival in a few months; it's my dream from my student days. But the band is on the verge of breaking up due to some issues, and I'm going through a tough time now. I hope to find someone to fill in.

(Hearing that a beginner guitarist wants to perform on stage sounds absurd, but holds a bit of admiration for such a person, envying that kind of reckless courage) Your situation sounds pretty complicated. Let me think about it. You should leave for now, and I'll give you an answer tomorrow afternoon, same time and place.

content.content: It's alright, you don't need to reply. I was too rash, just rushing over here and saying a lot of nonsense. Please don't take it to heart.
Why are you practicing piano after school too? Do you have a dream similar to mine? Let me hear about it.
I feel like our meeting today was destined. Even if we hadn't met today, it would have happened another time. I'm always waiting for you at the crossroads of fate!
This is my musical dream. I hope you can be the person who helps me achieve it. One day, when I've made a name for myself, I'll definitely repay you handsomely!

question: #question# How can Haruki express his capacity for social warmth, making others feel comfortable and happy?

content.content: Your piano playing is beautiful, with a narrative quality. There's so much depth to it. I'm Haruki, from Class 2-1, and I'd love to learn music skills and techniques from you. As long as you're willing to teach me, I'll do anything within my ability to assist you.
Our band is breaking up because two members started dating and then broke up. The lead singer took a bunch of people and left, so now I have to quickly form a new team.

Pardon my curiosity, are you a music student, or are you not an art student but simply have a pure love for music? I'd really like to learn music skills and techniques from you. As long as you’re willing to teach me, I'll do anything in my power to assist you.

I really want to learn musical knowledge and techniques from you. As long as you're willing to teach me, I'll do anything within my ability to help you. Tomorrow afternoon then, and be sure to give me an answer by then as promised!

question: #question# How can Haruki showcase his outstanding persuasive ability?

dialog.content: Since you put it that way, I won't insist. I live by the principle of avoiding unnecessary trouble, so let's pretend none of this happened today. Good luck, I'm sure you can achieve your dream of performing on stage.

Touma, not being fond of interacting with others, stopped staying at school to practice piano since this incident. Haruki still didn't realize that the pianist was Touma, who sat right next to him in class. In the end, until the school festival, Haruki never found the right person to regroup the band. The matter was shelved, and Haruki never mentioned that dream again.

(Very surprised to find that the person playing the piano is actually a classmate and the class president, slowly opens the music room door) Hello, Haruki, I didn't expect it to be you playing the guitar. If you want to learn, I have some quick ways to get you started.

(Surprised to see someone he knows playing the piano, and they're in the same class) Hi, Toma, is it really you? I had no idea you could play the piano, and so well at that. Your skills seem to be on par with a professional. Why are you in the general class? You should be in the music department, right?
(Hesitant, unsure how much to share about personal matters) It's a bit complicated. I was in the music department until my second year, but I transferred to the general class due to personal reasons.

content.content: Since you don't want to say much, you must have your reasons. I won't press further. Can you tell me more about your quick methods for learning guitar?
How was your experience in the music department? What's the typical ratio between general courses and specialized courses like?
Did you start in the music department from middle school? Were you always at Fengcheng High School, or did you transfer here?
You said it's complicated. How complicated? It seems like it's not something simple. Can you tell me more?

question: #question# How can Haruki demonstrate that he can empathize, sympathize, and understand others' feelings?

content.content: I see. You must have heard me playing the guitar next door. Pretty good for a beginner, right? I'm confident I'll reach a semi-professional level by the school festival. I seem to have a knack for this.
For an average person to reach your level on the piano, it shouldn't take very long, right? With consistent practice, maybe two or three years is enough?
A transfer, that explains it. I wondered why I didn't have any impression of you before. It seems I hadn't seen you prior to the second year.
Were you having trouble getting along with your previous classmates? Was there any bullying involved? If so, it's important to tell the class advisor promptly.

question: #question# How can Haruki ensure he remains confident at all times?

dialog.content: Whether you can learn quickly also depends on your own perception abilities. Many textbooks on the market teach incorrectly. I have a textbook here, written by an Italian teacher. When I was in elementary school, I practiced according to it and improved quite fast. You could give it a try.
Alright, thank you for your help. I won't disturb you further, I'll go back and study this book thoroughly.

Chunxi got a high-quality guitar learning textbook. After going back, he practiced the guitar diligently. Although his guitar skills improved, a guitarist alone cannot form a band. Ultimately, Chunxi wasn't able to perform at the school festival. He felt frustrated, but fortunately, he had the guitar textbook. In the future, Chunxi would practice hard, waiting for the next opportunity to meet someone destined.

(Feeling that Haruki's self-assessment is somewhat inaccurate, she can only respond politely) Hmm, you're doing quite well considering you've just started learning. If you keep up the intense practice, performing on stage should be no problem.

Touma did not want to get involved with Haruki's arrogance, so she politely but firmly declined Haruki's invitation to join the band. Haruki was ultimately unable to perform at the school festival, which left him very disappointed and shattered his self-confidence. He never touched another instrument again.
(Walking from school to a newly opened Japanese restaurant near home) Boss, I'll have an order of yakitori and eel rice.

profile.name: Setsuna
profile.public profile: Attends the same school and is in the same grade as Haruki, but not in the same class. Generally popular at school, she's a two-time champion of the campus beauty contest. She maintains a polite but slight emotional distance from her classmates, and is friendly yet slightly aloof. Secretly works part-time as a waiter in the restaurant, a fact mostly unknown to her schoolmates.
profile.goal: Doesn't want too much attention, wishes to live as a normal high school student

dialog.content: (The restaurant was too crowded, she got flustered, and when she brought the dishes to Haruki, she slipped, spilling some soup on Haruki's clothes) Oh no, I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. Are you okay? Did you get burned?

content.content: (Having a really unlucky day, and this just made things worse since now he needs to go home to wash his clothes) I'm not burned, but this T-shirt has a pretty big stain now. Could you ask the manager to come over and handle this? There needs to be some resolution to this matter.
Is this a pure Japanese restaurant? Besides Japanese food, do you have things like you-po noodles or rice noodles? If so, I'd like a serving.
You should quit this job. If this kind of mistake happens frequently in a short period, it means you might not be suited for the service industry.
This surely isn't eel rice, right? From the taste, it feels like mackerel. You probably got the menu wrong.

question: #question# How can Haruki demonstrate his excellent persuasive skills?

content.content: It's fine, it's fine. Just give me a wet wipe, I'll clean it myself. You go ahead and take care of your work, there's no problem here.
Slow down, even though I'm fine, if you run into someone unreasonable, your boss will surely scold you today.
No worries, as long as this bill is on the house, I don't mind if I get burned again, what do you say?
I remember eel rice usually isn't this hot. Is your method of making eel rice different from others?

question: #question# How can Haruki effectively manage his anger and irritation?

dialog.content: Alright, I'm really sorry about this. I'll get the manager right away, and we'll make sure you're compensated.

The owner of the Japanese restaurant waived Chunxi’s bill and offered a dessert. After finishing it, Chunxi felt that all the events of the day were hinting that forming a band wasn’t a good idea. He believed this interpretation and decided not to start a band, embracing the course set by fate.
Alright, alright, thank you so much. I'll get to work now. Just call me anytime if you need anything.

(Watching Xuecai bustling around in the store, Chunxi seems to recall something) Feels like I've seen her somewhere before. Was it the campus beauty contest? Why is she working in a place like this? With that hat and glasses, she's completely unrecognizable.
(Business in the store continues until after 8 PM, and as customers gradually leave, only Chunxi is left sitting) Hello, sir. Would you like to order anything else? We're about to close.
Oh, is that so? Sorry, I'll leave right away. Forgive me for asking, but are you Xuecai? I'm from Fengcheng High School. I think I've seen you at a school competition. I should be right, shouldn't I?
Yes, I am Xuecai. But I’d rather not let others know I’m working part-time at this Japanese restaurant. Could you keep it a secret for me? Thank you.

content.content: I can keep your secret. I have a small favor to ask you. I want to form a band to perform at the school festival. Do you know any singers or keyboard players? I'm looking for bandmates. You're a campus idol; do you have anyone suitable to recommend?
It's nice to meet you, Xuecai. I'm Chunxi, the class president of class 2. Feel free to contact me if you need anything.
Why not switch to another place for your part-time job? This Japanese restaurant is quite close to the school, so a lot of classmates might come here to eat.
Is working at a Japanese restaurant unusual? There's nothing to hide. I often work part-time at a convenience store myself.

question: #question# How should Chunxi express his creative thinking to come up with new ideas?

content.content: Sure, no problem. You probably have your reasons. Don't work too hard; it's not easy to do a part-time job every day. Take care of yourself.
It must not be easy for a campus idol either. I always thought you were the kind of girl who wouldn't show up in everyday life.
Why choose to work part-time at a Japanese restaurant? There should be other jobs more suitable for you, right?
Do you like Japanese food? What's your favorite dish, sushi, or rice and noodles?

question: #question# How should Chunxi speak to make others feel comfortable and happy in a social setting?

dialog.content: Even though I've participated in a lot of school activities, I don't particularly enjoy them. So, I usually make a quick exit once they finish. I don't really know anyone who likes music.

Xuecai doesn't trust this male student from the same school whom she's meeting for the first time. She doesn't want to have more interactions with Chunxi and hints that the Japanese restaurant is about to close. Chunxi gloomily leaves the restaurant, and his plan to invite Dongma to join the band fails the next day.
Thanks, why don't you wait for me a bit? I'll be done with work soon. Let's go to the nearby mall together and buy something, consider it a small compensation for getting your clothes dirty.
No need, no need, just walking around the mall with you is fine.

(After getting off work from the Japanese restaurant, heading to the mall with Haruki, chatting while walking around) The school festival is just a few months away. I wonder what events there will be this year.
I actually formed a band to sign up for the performances, but due to some reasons, all the band members left. I'm looking for new members now, not sure if I can make it in time.
If you don't mind, I could try out as the band's lead singer.
That's great, of course, there's no problem. I met a schoolmate who plays piano really well; she might be able to be our keyboard player. Let's go find her together tomorrow afternoon.

content.content: (The next afternoon, Haruki and Yukina go to the piano room to find Touma) Touma, have you thought it over? I thought about it yesterday; if you could join, our band would definitely win the best performance award at the school festival. It's such a great opportunity, don't hesitate.
If you're really not interested in joining, could you recommend someone suitable? Have you met any suitable keyboard players in the music department before?
I've noticed you are often late for class. Is it because you're practicing the piano until late every day?
We don't have much time, make a decision quickly. Who knows, this decision might change a lot of things.

question: #question# What can Haruki say to show his ability to remain optimistic when facing difficulties?

content.content: (The next afternoon, Haruki and Yukina go to the piano room to find Touma) Touma, I've found the lead singer for our band—Yukina. She's willing to join the school festival with us. Do you want to join? If you do, I'll be the guitarist, you'll be the keyboardist, and our team will be complete. We can start preparing our set list.
Touma, have you thought it over? I've found a lead singer for the band, and she's eager to start rehearsing.
Touma, I asked someone from the music department about you yesterday, and you're indeed a talented genius who has won many competitions.
Ever since I heard your piano, I haven't been able to forget it, so please, you must join our band. I'm begging you.

question: #question# What can Haruki say to demonstrate his exceptional teamwork skills, effectively collaborating with others to achieve a common goal?

dialog.content: Sorry, I'm really not interested in joining the performance. Why don't you look for someone else? I'm sure you'll find someone more suitable.

Touma found this class president's random soliloquies rather uncomfortable. Bringing another girl along this time also seemed quite strange. Haruki couldn't find a keyboardist, leading to the band's failure to form. Haruki complained to everyone he met, lamenting that he simply wasn't destined to form a band. After that, he never mentioned it again, quietly learning guitar by himself.
(Having heard of Setsuna, knowing she is a campus idol) This is starting to get interesting. Alright, I'll agree to join the band for now, but I reserve the right to leave anytime.
We're all set. Now we have the beginnings of our band. Let's discuss the performance pieces after school tomorrow.

(Rushing to find Haruki the next morning) Haruki, there's a problem. Starting next week, the Film Club has activities after school every day. I'm the vice president of the Film Club, so I might not be able to join the band.

content.content: It seems impossible to do both things. If it's really inconvenient, you don't have to force yourself to join the band. I'm still grateful that you agreed to be the lead singer yesterday.
Are you the vice president of the Film Club? You never mentioned that to me before.
I'm familiar with the Film Club president. I've worked with him before. Wait a moment, I'll go talk to him.
Is the Film Club really that important to you? Aren't you going to reconsider?

question: #question# How should Haruki communicate to demonstrate his excellent perspective-taking skill, showing empathy and understanding?

content.content: I'll talk to the president of the Film Club to see if we can coordinate schedules. I really don't want to see our newly formed band fall apart.
You're putting me in a tough spot. What should I say to Touma? She was quite happy yesterday.
What activities is the Film Club organizing next week? Do you have to be there every day? Is there any way to spare some time for the band?
Are you backing out of yesterday's agreement this quickly? That's quite fickle.
What kind of person is the Film Club president? Is he easy to talk to?
How about we have the band help the Film Club organize the event together?
This is so sudden. You didn't mention any of this when you agreed yesterday.

question: #question# How should Haruki express his ability to persist in tasks and strive toward achieving the goals?

dialog.content: Alright, thank you. If I get the chance, I'd love to try being the lead singer of a band. Let's catch up later.

Haruki did not insist on her staying. Xuecai dropped out midway, which made Touma furious. Touma vowed never to speak to Haruki again. Haruki's plan to form a band fell apart entirely, with irreconcilable conflicts among the potential band members making it utterly impossible to establish the band.
Should we go directly to him? It doesn't feel quite right, but let's give it a try, maybe it'll work.

(Went to find the film club president, who agreed to let Xuecai temporarily help with the band) Great, the film club is settled. I'll definitely treat the film club president to a meal as a thank you.

To everyone's surprise, Xuecai had an unexpectedly strong singing ability, and Dongma showcased extraordinary skills as a keyboardist. With their help, Chunxi's guitar skills improved rapidly. At the school festival two months later, the three successfully performed 'An Unreachable Love,' and the piece was a huge success.
